meanings.definition: To form or have a fringe
meanings.sent1: The curtains were fringing the window beautifully.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys fringing her scarves with colorful threads.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten kept fringing the tablecloth with its tiny claws.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight was fringing the clouds with a golden glow.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush skillfully fringing the painting with delicate strokes.

meanings.definition: To be on the edge or margin of something
meanings.sent1: The garden was fringing the backyard fence.
meanings.sent2: His house fringing the forest provided a peaceful retreat.
meanings.sent3: The adventurous explorer was always fringing danger.
meanings.sent4: The old book was fringing on the shelf, almost falling off.
meanings.sent5: The river fringing the meadow created a picturesque scene.

meanings.definition: A decorative border of hanging threads, cords, or strips
meanings.sent1: The rug had a beautiful fringing along its edges.
meanings.sent2: She admired the fringing on the lampshade in the living room.
meanings.sent3: The fringing on the costume made it look extra fancy.
meanings.sent4: The fringing on the pillow added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent5: The fringing on the banner fluttered gently in the breeze.
